Welcome to In-Silico Framework (ISF)’s documentation!¶

Interface

The purpose of this module is to glue together all libraries necessary for single cell simulations of cells in barrel cortex.

SLURM_scripts

barrel_cortex

Initialisation file for the barrel_cortex module

biophysics_fitting

compatibility

This module deals with API changes in 3rd party modules.

getting_started

mechanisms

model_data_base

nbrun

nbrun - Run an Jupyter/IPython notebook, optionally passing arguments.

project_specific_ipynb_code

simrun2

simrun3

single_cell_analyzer

library for analysis of simulation data (voltage traces, spike shapes, currents etc…) and anatomical data (synapse distances etc…)

single_cell_parser

cell parser and synapse mapper for single cell simulations with NeuroNet subcellular synapse distributions

singlecell_input_mapper

spike_analysis

tests

visualize

This init file imports all the important classes from this directory.

Usage¶

Have a look at the getting_started module for a variety of methods to get started on using ISF.
